snippet: Stock valuation can be more accurate when averaged over 10 years, but significant anomalies, like the great recession, may throw off the numbers.
abstract: Paul J Lim Fundamentally column holds that stock valuation can be more accurate when averaged over 10 years, but significant anomalies, like the great recession, may throw off the numbers.
lead_paragraph: Stock valuation can be more accurate when averaged over 10 years, but significant anomalies, like the great recession, may throw off the numbers.

headline.seo: Debating CAPE, a 10-Year Prism for Valuing Stocks
